results.title: Ararat
results.brief_description: When Noel Matthews watched this old film to see if it could go into the MAP project he realised that it was of enormous personal significance to him. This footage of Ararat township circa 1930 is combined with a voiceover by Noel explaining why watching this film had such a powerful effect. One of earliest submissions to the MAP project.

results.title: Aquarius: solo for 2 people
results.brief_description: Shows how a short ballet style dance performance evolves beginning with the dancer, Sandra Craig, meeting the composer. The film then shows the collaboration between Sandra, the composer, the director/choreographer and finally the male dancer as they create the final product.

results.title: Aquarium wonderland
results.brief_description: In microscopic and unusual close-up scenes and animation, we see how fish breathe, hear, feel, smell and swim. A boy shows how to set up and maintain an aquarium, using the proper amount of water, plants and food for the goldfish and other animal life it contains.

results.title: Aptitudes and occupations: an introduction to vocational guidance
results.brief_description: Discusses six of the fundamental human aptitudes: social, mechanical, clerical, musical, artistic and scholastic; and indicates how a student may, with the help of an educational or vocational counsellor, determine in which of these aptitudes they are most gifted. Indicates the broad fields of employment in which certain combinations of abilities are required. Narrated by Vincent Pelletier.

results.title: Time to learn
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Office of Intellectual Disability Services. Early Intervention Resource Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Early Intervention Series”.
This program is for all professionals who come into contact with young children with multiple disabilities. The issues explored are: The Impact of the diagnosis at birth. The impact of delayed diagnosis. The importance of the relationship between the child, parent and professionals. How therapists work with families. * Difficult behaviours. Family Stress. Respite care.

results.title: Adrian
results.creator_credit: Allan Kidston and Victoria. Office of Intellectual Disability Services
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Early Intervention Series”.
Adrian shows how children with developmental delay can be successfully integrated in kindergarten with cooperation between parents, kindergarten staff and the Early Intervention Program.

results.title: Approaches in early intervention
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Office of Intellectual Disabilities Services
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Early Intervention Series”.
This video looks at the history of Early Intervention, how it provides information, support and resources to families along with individual development programs in order to promote their child’s development. The different types of services are looked at as well as showing the importance of assessment. This program is one of a series on Early Intervention.

results.title: Applying a Therblig check list
results.brief_description: Illustrates how a Therblig checklist can be applied to jobs for the purpose of developing an improved method. The program demonstrates several jobs being performed and then applies the appropriate check list question for the purpose of devising an improved method.
